step1.sentence: After living abroad for three years, she finally came back to her hometown.

step2.story: The team had lost five games in a row and everyone thought the season was over. But they came back in the second half of the tournament and won three straight matches.

step3.story: The old neighborhood bakery had closed two years earlier when the owner retired. Everyone missed it but accepted it was gone. Then one spring morning, a sign appeared in the window saying it was coming back under new management. By opening day, there was a line stretching around the block and the smell of fresh bread filled the whole street again.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 떠났던 곳으로 다시 돌아오다; 다시 나타나거나 복귀하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 사람이 원래 있던 장소로 돌아오거나, 유행 또는 팀이 부진 후 복귀할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: come(오다)과 back(뒤로, 원래 위치)이 결합하여 원래 있던 곳으로 돌아온다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: get back이 이동의 결과에 초점을 두는 반면, come back은 돌아오는 방향 자체를 강조합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She came back from vacation looking completely rested.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 휴가에서 돌아왔을 때 완전히 쉰 것처럼 보였어요.
